Description: Wall and rim sherd of Attic red-figured pottery lekanis; interior: glazed black with reserved horizontal band at rim; top of rounded rim reserved; exterior: rim glazed black; on wall, red-figure decoration consisting of parts of three opposing palmettes.
Curator's comments: Object owned and held by Akademisches Kunstmuseum. This record is included in the British Museum database as part of the Museum’s Naukratis Project, a research collaboration that aims to virtually re-unite finds from the ancient port city of Naukratis, now distributed over 80 museums worldwide.

Piekarski gives the following comparanda: CVA Capua (2) III I pl. 20, 1-6; CVA Gotha (2) 20 pl. 71, 2; CVA Stuttgart (1) 38 pl. 33,3; Robinson, Olynthus XIII (1950) 179 no. 201 M pl. 119 The lekanis in Gotha is a good comparison.
Bibliographic references: Piekarski 2001 / Die Keramik aus Naukratis im Akademischen Kunstmuseum Bonn (p. 43 no. C 24 pl. 16.4)
Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GA.2100)
